text:
I just used the win32 installer for 5.5.14beta, and noticed that the installer 
reported the following disk usage stats:

Space required: 11.3MB
Space Available: 266.-9GB

Notice the ".-9"

There was actually just over 266GB free.

Kev
creator: kap@apama.com

text:
This is a bug in the NSIS installer and outside of our control. A quick look at
the release notes for the latest version doesn't give any indication that this
is fixed.

Your best bet is to report the bug directly to the NSIS developers at
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=22049&atid=373085
creator: markt@apache.org
shankarunni@netscape.net
text:
Rather than INVALID (the problem *is* a real one!), shouldn't the resolution be
WONTFIX?

creator: kap@apama.com
text:
Reported on NullSoft project as suggested.
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?
func=detail&aid=1380254&group_id=22049&atid=373085

Kev

creator: kap@apama.com
text:
I followed this up with the NSIS project. It seems the bug is fixed in version 
2.11, but someone forgot to mention it in the change notes.
https://sourceforge.net/support/tracker.php?aid=1380254

Maybe the next tomcat release could use a new version of the NSIS installer?

Regards,

Kev
